name: Snowdonia Ultra Trail Marathon Eryri

difficulty.label: Extreme
difficulty.technical: Technical mountain trails with significant exposure

description: A UTMB-indexed ultra through Snowdonia's most breathtaking terrain. The 57km route leaves Llanberis via Maesgwm, drops to Rhyd Ddu, then explores the hidden valleys of Cwm Trwsgl and Cwm Pennant before rejoining the marathon route at Nant Gwynant. The final challenge: ascending Yr Wyddfa (Snowdon) via the PyG track to the Finger Stone, followed by a glorious 7km descent to a heroes' welcome. With 2,199m of climbing across mountain paths, forest trails, slate quarries, and ancient tracks, this is a trail runner's paradise. Earn your 3 ITRA points and experience Wales' finest mountain running.
who_its_for: Experienced ultra runners with mountain running experience. Strong navigation skills recommended. Minimum age 20.
whats_special: Summit of Yr Wyddfa (Snowdon) on route
Hidden valleys of Cwm Trwsgl and Cwm Pennant
Diverse terrain: mountain, forest, slate quarries
mandatory_kit: Waterproof jacket and trousers (taped seams, attached hood)
